oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. Joseph W. Knox to his mother
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Joseph William Knox of Dyer, Tennessee, served in Co. E, 11th Inf. Regt. He arrived in France Sept. 1918 and fought the last week of the Meuse-Argonne offensive. He served guard duty after the armistice. He wrote that the sun was shining after days of rain, that he was having a good time, learning a word a day of the language and had a bed with springs. Knox said he was broke, but payday was a few days off, then wished his family Happy New Year. [See also GWjack018-024, 500-516]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
